items.title: Build your first GraphRAG Powered Agent! (No Graph Expert Required) | Databases for AI

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ This session demonstrates how to build a GraphRAG-powered knowledge graph in an afternoon using the same AI tools teams already use, making it possible to unlock information trapped in docs, PDFs, and wikis. items.title: Follow the carbon, find the money: Turning sustainability into financial value

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ Rich Goode, Sustainability Principal at PwC US, explains that linking carbon reduction to financial impact is essential for engaging business leaders. Translating emissions outcomes into cost savings and business valueâ€”and understanding carbon accounting fundamentalsâ€”helps move sustainability from ambition to action and drives alignment, investment, and results.
bullets: Rich Goode (PwC US) emphasizes framing sustainability in business/financial terms.
A ton of carbon is abstract; financial value resonates with leadership.
Translate emissions outcomes into cost savings and measurable business value.
Understand carbon accounting fundamentals to communicate and measure progress.
takeaways: Quantify emissions reductions in financial terms to justify efficiency and decarbonization investments.
Apply carbon accounting fundamentals to accurately measure and report grid/data center emissions.
Frame sustainability proposals around cost savings and business value to secure leadership buy-in and funding.
Convert emissions metrics into operational KPIs to turn plans into measurable results.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy is a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California who brings in $251K a year from three jobs in the Bay Area and runs a personal finance brand. She amassed nearly $1 million in debt by 2015, documented her debt-payoff journey through her business Financially Intentional, and was debt-free by 2017.
bullets: Labor and delivery nurse and personal finance creator based in Brentwood, CA.
Earns $251K annually from three jobs in the Bay Area.
Had nearly $1M in debt in 2015.
Launched Financially Intentional to document her debt-payoff journey.
Reached debt-free status by 2017.
takeaways: Combined income from multiple jobs ($251K) correlated with rapid debt reduction (nearly $1M in 2015 to debt-free by 2017).
Documenting a personal finance journey enabled creation of a brand (Financially Intentional) as an additional income/engagement channel.
High earnings do not necessarily mean absence of significant debtâ€”employee financial situations can be complex.
The account illustrates the potential value of financial education and side-income strategies for improving personal financial resilience.

items.title: GeForce Garage - Summer of RTX Community Build

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ NVIDIA's GeForce Garage highlights the winner of the Summer of RTX r/buildapc Community Build contest, u/JeffersonPutnam, who built a small-form-factor system centered on a GeForce RTX 5090 Founders Edition. The video lists the full parts (Fractal Design Era 2 chassis, MSI MPG B850I Edge, Ryzen 7 9800X3D, 32GB DDR5-6000, Corsair SF1000, Corsair Nautilus 240 RS) and links to the PCPartPicker build.
bullets: Winner: u/JeffersonPutnam â€” SFF GeForce RTX 5090 build
Chassis: Fractal Design Era 2 (small form-factor)
Key components: RTX 5090 FE, Ryzen 7 9800X3D, MSI MPG B850I Edge, 32GB DDR5-6000
Power and cooling: Corsair SF1000 PSU and Corsair Nautilus 240 RS AIO

takeaways: RTX 5090 deployed in a small-form-factor system â€” compact builds must address high-performance GPU integration.
Mini-ITX motherboard selection (MSI MPG B850I Edge) highlights footprint and compatibility considerations for dense deployments.
Use of a 1000W SFX unit (Corsair SF1000) underscores planning for sufficient power delivery in constrained spaces.
